t: Jeremiah 23
The Coming Messiah: the Righteous Branch
“Woe*p to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of My pasture!” declares the Lord.*s

Therefore thus says the Lord*s God of Israel concerning the shepherds who are tending My people: “You have scattered My flock and driven them away, and have not attended to them; behold, I am about to attend to you for the evil of your deeds,” declares the Lord.*s
“Then I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock out of all the countries where I have driven them and bring them back to their pasture, and they will be fruitful and multiply.
I will also raise up shepherds over them and they will tend them; and they will not be afraid any longer, nor be terrified, nor will any be missing,” declares the Lord.*s

“Behold,*pn the*i days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “When*ln I will raise up for David a righteous Branch; And*ln He will reign as king and act wisely And*ln do justice and righteousness in the land.
In*ln His days Judah will be saved, And*ln Israel will dwell securely; And*ln this is His name by which He will be called, ‘The*ln Lord*s our righteousness.’
“Therefore*p behold, the*i days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when they will no longer say, ‘As the Lord*s lives, who brought up the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt,’

but, ‘As the Lord*s lives, who brought up and led back the descendants of the household of Israel from the*i north land and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ Then they will live on their own soil.”
False Prophets Denounced

As*pn for the prophets: My*ln heart is broken within me, All*ln my bones tremble; I*ln have become like a drunken man, Even*ln like a man overcome with wine, Because*ln of the Lord*s And*ln because of His holy words.
For*ln the land is full of adulterers; For*ln the land mourns because of the curse. The*ln pastures of the wilderness have dried up. Their*ln course also is evil And*ln their might is not right.
“For*ln both prophet and priest are polluted; Even*ln in My house I have found their wickedness,” declares the Lord.*s

“Therefore*ln their way will be like slippery paths to them, They*ln will be driven away into the gloom and fall down in it; For*ln I will bring calamity upon them, The*ln year of their punishment,” declares the Lord.*s
“Moreover,*ln among the prophets of Samaria I saw an offensive thing: They*ln prophesied by Baal and led My people Israel astray.

Also*ln among the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a horrible thing: The*ln committing of adultery and walking in falsehood; And*ln they strengthen the hands of evildoers, So*ln that no one has turned back from his wickedness. All*ln of them have become to Me like Sodom, And*ln her inhabitants like Gomorrah.

Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts concerning the prophets, ‘Behold,*pn I am going to feed them wormwood And*ln make them drink poisonous water, For*ln from the prophets of Jerusalem Pollution*ln has gone forth into all the land.’ ”

Thus*ln says the Lord*s of hosts, “Do*ln not listen to the words of the prophets who are prophesying to you. They*ln are leading you into futility; They*ln speak a vision of their own imagination, Not*ln from the mouth of the Lord.*s

They*ln keep saying to those who despise Me, ‘The*ln Lord*s has said, “You will have peace” ’; And*ln as for everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart, They*ln say, ‘Calamity will not come upon you.’
But*ln who has stood in the council of the Lord,*s That*ln he should see and hear His word? Who*ln has given heed to His word and listened?
Behold,*ln the storm of the Lord*s has gone forth in wrath, Even*ln a whirling tempest; It*ln will swirl down on the head of the wicked.
The*ln anger of the Lord*s will not turn back Until*ln He has performed and carried out the purposes of His heart; In*ln the last days you will clearly understand it.
I*ln did not send these*i prophets, But*ln they ran. I*ln did not speak to them, But*ln they prophesied.
But*ln if they had stood in My council, Then*ln they would have announced My words to My people, And*ln would have turned them back from their evil way And*ln from the evil of their deeds.
“Am*ln I a God who is near,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln not a God far off?
Can*ln a man hide himself in hiding places So*ln I do not see him?” declares the Lord.*s “Do*ln I not fill the heavens and the earth?” declares the Lord.*s
“I*p have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy falsely in My name, saying, ‘I had a dream, I had a dream!’
How long? Is there anything*i in the hearts of the prophets who prophesy falsehood, even these*i prophets of the deception of their own heart,
who intend to make My people forget My name by their dreams which they relate to one another, just as their fathers forgot My name because of Baal?
The prophet who has a dream may relate his*i dream, but let him who has My word speak My word in truth. What does straw have in*i common*i with grain?” declares the Lord.*s
“Is not My word like fire?” declares the Lord,*s “and like a hammer which shatters a rock?
Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” declares the Lord,*s “who steal My words from each other.
Behold, I am against the prophets,” declares the Lord,*s “who use their tongues and declare, ‘The*i Lord*i declares.’

Behold, I am against those who have prophesied false dreams,” declares the Lord,*s “and related them and led My people astray by their falsehoods and reckless boasting; yet I did not send them or command them, nor do they furnish this people the slightest benefit,” declares the Lord.*s
“Now*p when this people or the prophet or a priest asks you saying, ‘What is the oracle of the Lord?’*s then you shall say to them, ‘What oracle?’ The Lord*s declares, ‘I will abandon you.’
Then as for the prophet or the priest or the people who say, ‘The oracle of the Lord,’*s I will bring punishment upon that man and his household.
Thus will each of you say to his neighbor and to his brother, ‘What has the Lord*s answered?’ or, ‘What has the Lord*s spoken?’
For you will no longer remember the oracle of the Lord,*s because every man’s own word will become the oracle, and you have perverted the words of the living God, the Lord*s of hosts, our God.
Thus you will say to that*i prophet, ‘What has the Lord*s answered you?’ and, ‘What has the Lord*s spoken?’

For if you say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’*s surely thus says the Lord,*s ‘Because you said this word, “The oracle of the Lord!”*s I have also sent to you, saying, “You shall not say, ‘The oracle of the Lord*s !’ ” ’
Therefore behold, I will surely forget you and cast you away from My presence, along with the city which I gave you and your fathers.
I will put an everlasting reproach on you and an everlasting humiliation which will not be forgotten.”
